body.p: SMART update request is used to get the smart information managed by the Wearleveling Manager. The Wearleveling Manager maintains the following smart information

li.p: Indicates device has too many read or write errors.

p.draft-comment: TBD When to set this flag? How many read errors?.

li.p: Indicates device is in read-only mode. Wearleveling Manager sets this bit when system free block count is zero.
Represents percentage of the spare reserved for over provisioning. The Wearleveling Manager reserves 25% of spare and it is configurable.
Represents threshold value to generate asynchronous event when the available spare falls below this value. It’s value is fixed in the Wearleveling Manager, 5 virtual blocks.
Indicates available spare falls below available spare threshold. When the device free block count goes below available spare threshold, spare warning bit will be set.

Represents the percentage of device life used, based on the actual device usage and the manufacturer’s prediction of device life. A value of 100 indicates that the estimated endurance of the device has been consumed, but it may not indicate a device failure. The value is allowed to exceed 100. Percentages greater than 254 shall be represented as 255. Percent used is taken from the system average erase count.

body.p: When SMART update request is received, the Wearleveling Manager sends smart information maintained in local data structure with SMART completion message.
